website_summaries.verdict: Call of Duty: Black Ops Declassified is a huge disappointment that does nothing right.
cons: Short, aggravating single-player campaignNo save feature in solo missionsDumb enemy AIControl issues exacerbated by dull, linear levelsBuggy MP made even worse with too-small maps

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous
customer_reviews.text: This game should be worth no more than $10. The shooting mechanics are terrible. The aiming is always off and seems to glitch. There is no story at all. There are also no checkpoints so if you die you restart the entire mission. The bots have very dumb AI's. The only reason this game isn't getting one star is because of the multiplayer which is alright. But do not pay more than $10 for this game. There are much better games out there for the current marketed price of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Renteria

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend on vita
customer_reviews.text: Great mobile Call of Duty. The multiplayer is great, the maps are fairly small but they work well on the vita. Definitely a Call of Duty game, perks, kill streaks, and COD maps all on the go. The campaign is short (each level takes less than 10 minutes) but fun. Spans Cold War era 1960's to 1990). Wish I hadn't listened to the negative reviews and got the game earlier. It is my favorite shooter on the vita (Killzone is good too, but gameplay feels slower). Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: J Boogie

customer_reviews.title: not really worth it
customer_reviews.text: the campaign will make you rage people were not kidding when they said the same thing, even on the easiest difficulty its very hard to even beat a level, but the only good part is i guess the multiplayer even though it lags out and kicks you out and having trouble connecting to a lobby

customer_reviews.title: Good FPS for a handheld
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why people are hating on this game so hard. It's not the worst game I've played, and it's also not the best. Yes the single player doesn't have a good story but when has a Call of Duty game ever been played for its single player? The multiplayer is what you're paying for here. Bottom Line: If you like the normal Call of Duty multiplayer then you should get this game. If you don't then don't consider buying this because you'll hate it.

customer_reviews.title: Resold the same day I bought it
customer_reviews.text: To be 100% honest I purchased this game on sale despite the poor scores because I was curious and some of the reviews are hopeful for this game. Let me tell you now there's no game in this game. I played the multi-player for a few minutes which was hilarious. The maps for multi-player are so small that generally you spawn on other players. The campaign is in the style of UNIT 13 which I was also uninterested in. The game has tight controls but with a "specs op" only like mode for the campaign and a multi-player that is stale after playing each map only once my advice is to stay away.

customer_reviews.title: Not a good COD on the go
customer_reviews.text: PSPS COD game: Roads to victory was better than this. That game had a unified single player campaign. This one has standalone missions a la ‘Unit 13’. I do like the graphics and sound ( as long as you are using headphones). Killzone mercenary had a better control scheme. There are no checkpoints during the missions, so if you have to die, you’ll start all over again. The multiplayer is fun. Overall, I highly recommend Killzone: Mercenary for a FPS vita game.

customer_reviews.title: Don't Be Fooled
customer_reviews.text: This game, while under the Call of Duty name, is far from the quality of the other games. The controls are awful and it is rare to find somebody online to play with. The worst part about this game is that, during the campaign, there are no autosaves or check points. If you fail a level you start from the beginning. This is a real shame from a game that was supposed to bridge the game between Black Ops 1 and Black Ops 2 as well as legitimize the Playstation Vita as a series platform.
customer_reviews.author: PrestonP

customer_reviews.title: Great Game but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really fun game, that can keep you occupied for hours at a time. My only beef with this game making me give it 3 Stars is Cons: Glitches Crashes Lag Bugs No Camos Not Many Maps Poor Map Load Time Pros: Fun to play alone or with friends It feels good and is rewarding to level up The maps are all nice Graphics are pretty good for a handheld Nice choices of guns Great Balancing (So you shouldn't feel the need to rage, except at the glitches, crashes, and bugs)

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be much better
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, this game was much better than I expected. I Bought the game thinking it would be the worst thing I have ever played on the vita, but I was pleasantly surprised with a fun, portable Call of Duty experience. The game is fun, but full of potential. The multiplayer is the main reason to buy this game, because the campaign, just wasn't good at all when compared to Call of Duty campaigns. In fact, it wasn't really a campaign at all, more like time trial missions. Over all, if you find this game for a decent price, I'd say buy it. It is not worth the original 50$ price though. Hope this could help someone out!

customer_reviews.title: Good game, but associate gave me wrong information about the contents

The associate told me it was brand new, unopened, in its original blue case. It didn't have a case. They did include some PS Vita AR cards, which is nice, but they weren't what I wanted. In conclusion, I'd give it a good rating for coming in early and being a nice game. However, I'm taking off two stars for not being what I ordered.

product_meta.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops - Declassified - PlayStation Vita
product_meta.description: Before the future could be won, history had to be written. Exposing that story exclusively on PlayStation® Vita, Call of Duty®: Black Ops Declassified explores original fiction in the Call of Duty® Black Ops universe with an all-new campaign of Special Ops missions. Optimized for gamers on-the-go, Call of Duty® Black Ops: Declassified delivers the most intense handheld Call of Duty® experience to date, including both Special Ops Story mode and Multiplayer combat tailored for the PS Vita.
feature_bullets: Wi-Fi-enabled 4 v 4 multiplayer gameplay on franchise favorite modes, including Free-For-All, Kill Confirmed, Team Deathmatch and Dropzone, all tailored for the PS Vita system.
Utilize classic Call of Duty multiplayer features like Care Packages, Challenges, Create-a-Class, Killstreaks, Perks, Prestiging, XP and more.
Choose from lethal and tactical grenades, and a variety weapons and attachments.
An exclusive installment in the Call of Duty: Black Ops series told through a series of single player objective-based operations, along with Survival and Time Trial Missions.
Touch screen controls for tossing grenades and melee attacks bring the power of PS Vita into your hands.
